summary:
MLB is the top baseball league in the U.S. and Canada, with 30 teams. It was formed in 1903 when the National League and American League merged. The league is the oldest professional sports league globally and is headquartered in New York City.

Baseball became popular after a 1919 cheating scandal, and in the 1950s, teams started moving to new cities. The league expanded in the 1960s, adding eight new teams. Players' unions fought for better labor practices, leading to free agency.

MLB is very popular, with millions of fans and high revenue. It has the most extensive season attendance worldwide and manages minor leagues and international tournaments.
title: Major League Baseball
